intro: Erica haemastoma, commonly known as the red heath, is a flowering plant native to the western Cape of South Africa. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, commonly referred to as the heath or heather family. The plant produces dense clusters of small, bright red flowers that bloom in winter and early spring. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Erica haemastoma is often used in rock gardens and as a decorative plant due to its ornamental value and hardy nature.
